question: 燃やす
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>burn</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to burn something</vocabulary> (or <vocabulary>to burn</vocabulary>).
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is when you're burning something. To remember this meaning, you have to remember the <ja>も</ja> part. So, just think of your friend <reading>Mo</reading>e (<ja>も</ja>), and how you're going to burn him... uh... just a little bit.
